page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Overlooking Pegwell bay is "Hugin",a perfect replica of a viking boat,built in Denmark and rowed to Thanet in 1949,to mark the 1,500th anniversary of the landing of Hengist and Horsa. It was bought by the "Daily Mail",and presented by Lord Rothermere to the people of Thanet as a permanent memorial. It stands near the Sandwich road,just opposite the Viking Ship Hotel. {Near Cliffsend is a replica of a Saxon {Cross which commemorates the landing {of St.Augustine 449 A.D. at Ebbsfleet. {After many dangers from sea and land {he landed at Richborough shore,Thanet. {The memory of these events is written {on the foot of the stone cross which {was errected by the Earl of Granville, {the Lord Warden of the Cinque Ports. }
